uws.service.file

Interface UWSFileManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LocalUWSFileManager

    public interface UWSFileManager

    Lets accessing any file managed by a UWS service.

    It is particularly useful if you want to organize yourself the results, log or backup file generated and read by a UWS.

    Version:
    4.1 (11/2014)
    Author:
    Grégory Mantelet (CDS;ARI)
    See Also:
    LocalUWSFileManager

    • Field Detail

      • TMP_UPLOAD_DIR

        static final java.io.File TMP_UPLOAD_DIR

        Temporary directory in which uploaded files will be stored when parsing the HTTP request.

        IMPORTANT 1: Uploaded files should be then moved using UploadFile.move(UWSJob) when the job creation or update is validated.

        IMPORTANT 2: As qualified above, this directory is temporary. It means that it should be emptied sometimes. It is particularly important because when a delete or move operation fails on uploaded files, no log or error might be published.

        Note: The default value is the temporary directory of the system (i.e. \tmp or \var\tmp on Unix/Linux/MacOS, c:\temp on Windows).

        Since:
        4.1

      • getLogInput

        java.io.InputStream getLogInput(UWSLog.LogLevel level,
                              java.lang.String context)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Gets an input stream on the log file of this UWS.
        Parameters:
        level - Level of the message to log (DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR or FATAL).
        context - Context of the message to log (UWS, HTTP, JOB, THREAD, ...).
        Returns:
        An input on the log file or null if there is no log file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there is an error while opening an input stream on the log file.

                               java.lang.String context)
                                 throws java.io.IOException

        Gets an output stream on the log file of this UWS.

        note: The log file must be automatically created if needed.

        Parameters:
        level - Level of the message to log (DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR or FATAL).
        context - Context of the message to log (UWS, HTTP, JOB, THREAD, ...).
        Returns:
        An output on the log file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there is an error while creating the log file or while opening an output stream on it.

        Parameters:

      • openURI

        java.io.InputStream openURI(java.net.URI uri)
                            throws UnsupportedURIProtocolException,
                                   java.io.IOException

        Open a stream toward the given URI.

        Most of the time, the given URI uses the protocol http, https or ftp, which makes the URI perfectly understandable by URL which is then able to open easily a stream (cf URL.openStream()). However, a different scheme/protocol could be used ; particularly VO ones like "ivo" and "vos". It is for these particular cases that this function has been designed: in order to provide an implementation supporting additional protocols.

        Parameters:
        uri - URI of any resource to read.
        Returns:
        Input to the specified resource.
        Throws:
        UnsupporteURIProtocol - If the protocol is not supported by this implementation.
        java.io.IOException - If another error occurs while opening the stream.
        UnsupportedURIProtocolException
        Since:
        4.1

      • deleteUpload

        void deleteUpload(UploadFile upload)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Delete definitely the specified file, submitted inline in an HTTP request.
        Parameters:
        upload - Description of the uploaded file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If any error occurs while deleting the file.
        Since:
        4.1

      • moveUpload

        java.lang.String moveUpload(UploadFile upload,
                          UWSJob destination)
                            throws java.io.IOException

        Move the specified file from its current location to a location related to the given job.

        Note: This function is generally used only once: after the HTTP request parsing, when creating or updating a job and only if the action has been accepted.

        IMPORTANT: This function might not be able to update the location inside the given UploadFile. For this reason, it is strongly recommended to not call directly this function, but to use UploadFile.move(UWSJob).

        Parameters:
        upload - Description of the uploaded file to move.
        destination - Job in which the uploaded file will be used.
        Returns:
        The new location of the uploaded file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If any error occurs while moving the file.
        Since:
        4.1

                                 UWSJob job)
                                   throws java.io.IOException

        job - The job of the given result.
        Returns:

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there is an error while getting the result file size.

        Returns:

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there is a grave and unexpected error while deleting the result file.

      • getBackupInput

        java.io.InputStream getBackupInput(JobOwner owner)
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                          java.io.IOException
        Gets an input stream on the backup file of ONLY the given job owner (~ UWS user).
        Parameters:
        owner - Owner whose the jobs must be fetched from the file on which the input stream is asked.
        Returns:
        An input on the backup file of the given owner or null if there is no backup file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given owner is null.
        java.io.IOException - If there is an error while opening an input stream on the backup file.

        Returns:
        An iterator on all job owner's backup file.

      • getBackupOutput

                                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                            java.io.IOException

        Gets an output stream on the backup file of ONLY the given job owner (~ UWS user).

        note: The backup file must be automatically created if needed.

        Parameters:
        owner - Owner whose the jobs must be saved in the file on which the output stream is asked.
        Returns:
        An output on the backup file of the given owner.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given owner is null.
        java.io.IOException - If there is an error while creating the backup file or while opening an output stream on it.
